leaderboard module

leaderboard.clear()[source]

Clears the console screen based on the operating system.

leaderboard.clear_current_map_leaderboard(map_file)[source]

Removes all scores associated with a specific map from ‘leaderboard.txt’.

Reads all records, filters out those belonging to the specified map, and rewrites the file with the remaining records.

Parameters:

map_file (str) – The path or name of the map to clear scores for.

leaderboard.load_leaderboard(map_file)[source]

Loads and sorts scores for a specific map from ‘leaderboard.txt’.

Reads the leaderboard file, filters entries matching the provided map name, and sorts them by time taken (ascending).

Parameters:

map_file (str) – The path or name of the map to load scores for.

Returns:

A list of tuples where each tuple contains (name, time_taken). The list is sorted with the fastest times first.

Return type:

list[tuple]

leaderboard.main_menu()[source]

Displays the main game menu and prompts the user for a selection.

Prints the game title ASCII art and the available options: 1. Play Game 2. View Leaderboard 3. Exit

Returns:

The option selected by the user (e.g., “1”, “2”, “3”).

Return type:

str

leaderboard.map_selector()[source]

Lists available map files in the ‘maps’ directory and handles user selection.

Scans the ‘maps’ folder for .txt files. If no maps or directory are found, defaults to ‘testmap.txt’.

Returns:

The relative path to the selected map file (e.g., ‘maps/level1.txt’).

Return type:

str

leaderboard.player_setup()[source]

Prompts the player to enter a non-empty username.

Loop continues until a valid name is provided.

Returns:

The validated username entered by the player.

Return type:

str

leaderboard.save_score(name, time_taken, map_file)[source]

Appends a player’s score to the ‘leaderboard.txt’ file.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The player’s username.

  • time_taken (float) – The time elapsed to complete the level.

  • map_file (str) – The path or name of the map played.

leaderboard.show_leaderboard(map_file)[source]

Displays the top 10 scores for the selected map and handles clearing options.

Prints the leaderboard to the console. Also provides an option for the user to clear the leaderboard for the current map.

Parameters:

map_file (str) – The path or name of the map to display scores for.
